text: Can I check with you what we are trying to do on HubSpot before I proceed further. We are trying to use HubSpot APIs to programmatically fill up data from our database to the editable areas in the email template for eg. Sales figures. I have already created a HTML template based on the guide I found but there is nothing written about having custom editable tags where we can update the content (numbers) into the HTML template.
I don't use the .Net wrapper you mentioned, I use the Nodejs client - glad you found a solution.

Just FYI: there is a C# client - I like to use the clients because the docs show the sample code in each language for the client code in the docs and more importantly you can quickly test from right there on the docs page easily - works for me.  I actually wrote my own API service module when I first started out because I didn't know they provided a client.  But I have switched over to using the client most of the time.

Hey Laurens, yeah i think it only works for the named “pseudo” associations.contact - deal - tickets - company - quotes

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/search#search-through-associations>

But  you could do that search you want, from you picture, if you did the search on the contact and supplied company id as adrian is saying then you would get all contacts associated with that company id
Super huge !

I'm currently trying to use the Workflow API to create multiple Workflows. I have some issues with the segmentCriterias. I added a PAGE_VIEW filter, and it worked well, but I have some issues with the "coalescingRefineBy". Here's the object sent to the API and the results. The expected result should have a "at least 3 times" mention.

Has anyone here use this api before ?
I have also tried this way

:wave: Hello, team!

I'm new to HubSpot and APIs in general, and have been trying to work on Extract + Load of data. Trying to get the basic properties of each of the objects by making API calls `client.crm.companies.get_all()`  and similar (deals, objects w/ object_type='Meetings'.) The data available is minimal and sometimes only HubSpot object IDs and a couple of timestamps. Is this the usual expected response?

How do I get (for eg:) the default company properties mentioned <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/properties/HubSpot-crm-default-company-properties|here>?

I'm not sure for this particular endpoint, but sometime to pass query params to specify which data you want in your responses. Ex.: To get the filters in the GET list API, you have to pass ?includeFilters=true

Might be the same thing in your case. Hope it helps !
Hi Jean-Pierre! If I understood correctly, the solution you provided would filter the response to only the fields I need, right?

It's not working as a filter. It's to ask the API to give you more informations in the responses. In my example, it includes the "filters" of the list configuration. I can see where I confused you using an example with the word "filters" hahaha.
Ah, understood! Let me look into this direction more, thank you!!
You might find more information on this page : <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/companies>
Thanks!
I'm not sure, but take a look at this api endpoint to generate a file URL : *`GET /files/v3/files/{fileId}/signed-url`*
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CBA9UA4EN/p1717781542049339>
Do you know how to access s3?, since it also gives me a url that is s3, is this
```<https://cdn1.HubSpot.com/hubfs/5310206/rich_text_hidden_files_ccf76491-6675-4356-b3ba-ac0184d322b7/18827137416-IM-LCL-KERRY-HOLANDA-CR-PO%2051138024.pdf>```
Do you know how to access S3?
I'm not sure I understand your question

Hi team! Our OAuth integration with HubSpot recently stopped working with the error referencing a bad client ID:

`Authentication failure! invalid_credentials: OAuth2::Error, {"status":"BAD_CLIENT_ID","message":"missing or unknown client id","correlationId":"97c3ec21-7ee2-4a43-b3e7-04de3311b198"}`

This same issue takes place across 3 of our apps, all of them using Rails + Devise + Omniauth gem. I can confirm that the CLIENT_ID is correct and is correctly passed to the URL when making the initial request to HubSpot for the user to login and grant access. The scopes and redirect URI are also correct and initialized as recommended in devise.rb:

`config.omniauth :HubSpot, ENV['HubSpot_CLIENT_ID'], ENV['HubSpot_SECRET_ID'], scope: 'crm.objects.contacts.write timeline crm.objects.companies.write crm.lists.write crm.lists.read crm.objects.deals.write crm.objects.contacts.read' unless !ENV['HubSpot_CLIENT_ID']`

Is anybody else experiencing this? I’m pretty stumped as I’ve tried various changes and cannot get HubSpot to recognize our client as valid.

Thank you in advance!

Does anyone know if you can create a developer app to use without publishing it for public use vs. the private app that is limited with what you can do? We are struggling with accesses custom objects in our webhooks while using the private app. Also need to reference activities from webhooks. THank you
Is it possible to create an association type, resp. create associations for line items and custom objects through the API (or any other way)?
You can create an OAuth authenticated app without submitting it to the Marketplace as a public app.  You could then install the app on multiple portals.

I'm looking for the is open and is closed fields in the deals API but I can't find it in the documentation or in the properties/associations. I can see the fields on Zapier though and can access them there but not sure how to access them in my js file, does anyone have any idea where to find this?
Thank you!
Never mind, I figured it out.
We do work only with private apps and I haven't faced any issues about it. We do use webhooks also. What are the issues you're facing ?
Is it me or people mostly asks questions and do not try much to help others?

we are trying to create webhooks for custom objects, which it seems like we can do with workflows? Is that how you handle that, since the webhooks within the private app itself are limited to the standard objects?
Oh! We only works with the standard objects. This might be the main difference
sry I read your question to quickly and missed this mention
do you do anything on activity? or just the standard objects?
Just standard objects (contacts, company, deals... mostly)
ok, thanks
my guess would be thats probably true because HubSpot support sends so many people here.... <@U077MQPNYAY>

We do work with a HubSpot partner, and they sent us to the customer support because they didn't knew the answer, and the support sent me here hahaha. Guess the terms "experts" and "support" don't mean what it used to hahaha

At least we should take the time to help each other instead of asking questions blindly while disregarding the others'.
